title: 6 Easy Ways to Screenshot on Samsung Galaxy S23

steps.title: Simultaneously press the Volume Down and Power buttons quickly.
steps.content: Simultaneously press the Volume Down and Power buttons quickly. They are both located on the right side of your phone. The Power button is also known as the Power or Side button. Your screen will flash, and you'll hear a camera shutter if your sound is enabled. You will see a thumbnail of your picture at the bottom of your phone's screen.

steps.title: Find your screenshot.
steps.content: Find your screenshot. A pop-up will appear at the bottom of the screen containing a thumbnail of your screenshot. You can tap the thumbnail to view your screenshot. You can also find your screenshots in the Gallery in the Screenshots album. You can also find editing tools in the menu at the bottom of the screen. You can use these tools to edit and mark up your screenshot.

steps.title: Make sure the gesture is enabled.
steps.content: Make sure the gesture is enabled. To do so, go to Settings and search palm swipe to capture . Once there, ensure the toggle is on (blue and pointing to the right).

steps.title: Move your palm from right to left over your phone.
steps.content: Move your palm from right to left over your phone. Your palm should be in a karate-chop position with your pinky facing down towards the phone's screen as you swipe from the right side of the screen to the left. The screen will flash once to indicate that it has captured the screen.

steps.title: Find your screenshot.
steps.content: Find your screenshot. A window will pop up at the bottom of the screen that you can tap to see your screen capture. You can also find your screenshots in the Gallery in the Screenshots album. You can also find editing tools in the menu at the bottom of the screen. You can use these tools to edit and mark up your screenshot. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure you have Bixby Voice or Google Assistant set up.
steps.content: Make sure you have Bixby Voice or Google Assistant set up. You can start Bixby and set up the voice assistant's features by pressing the Side button. If the functionality of the Side button was changed, find and change the Side button again to summon Bixby so you can set it up. Go to Settings > Advanced features > Side key to return the Bixby functionality of the Side button. If you prefer to use Google Assistant , open the Google app and enable "Hey Google" in your settings.

steps.title: Say "Hey Bixby" or "Hey Google" and "Take a screenshot."
steps.content: Say "Hey Bixby" or "Hey Google" and "Take a screenshot." The screen will flash when it has captured what's on the screen.

steps.title: Find your screenshot.
steps.content: Find your screenshot. A window will pop up at the bottom of the screen that you can tap to see your screen capture. You can also find your screenshots in the Gallery in the Screenshots album. You can also find editing tools in the menu at the bottom of the screen. You can use these tools to edit and mark up your screenshot.

steps.title: Remove the S Pen from the bottom of your phone.
steps.content: Remove the S Pen from the bottom of your phone. If you have an S23 Ultra, you have the S Pen stylus to write, draw, and control your phone without your finger.

steps.title: Press and hold the button on the pen and tap the pen on the phone's screen.
steps.content: Press and hold the button on the pen and tap the pen on the phone's screen. The screen will flash once to indicate that it has captured the screen.

steps.title: Find your screenshot.
steps.content: Find your screenshot. A window will pop up at the bottom of the screen that you can tap to see your screen capture. You can also find your screenshots in the Gallery in the Screenshots album. You can also find editing tools in the menu at the bottom of the screen. You can use these tools to edit and mark up your screenshot.

steps.title: Remove your S Pen.
steps.content: Remove your S Pen. If you are using a Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra, you can use Smart Select to take a screenshot. Start by removing the S Pen.

steps.title: Tap the pencil icon.
steps.content: Tap the pencil icon. It should appear on the left or right side of your screen when you remove the S Pen. This displays a menu.

steps.title: Tap Smart Select.
steps.content: Tap Smart Select . It's the third option in the menu that appears when you tap the pencil icon. [2] X Research source Using Smart Select is the only way to capture a portion of your screen before taking a screenshot. You can edit the screenshots using other methods to crop the section of the picture that you want.

steps.title: Tap a Smart Select tool.
steps.content: Tap a Smart Select tool. Use Rectangle, Lasso, Oval, or GIF to capture your entire screen or only a portion. You can also use Smart Select's GIF option to capture a video of what's on your screen!

steps.title: Drag your S Pen over your screen to select the area to capture.
steps.content: Drag your S Pen over your screen to select the area to capture. This will display a shape of marching ants over your selection. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Save icon.
steps.content: Tap the Save icon. It's the icon that resembles a square with an arrow pointing down. It's at the bottom of the screen. This saves a screenshot of your selection. You can find this image again later in your Gallery.

steps.title: Take a screenshot.
steps.content: Take a screenshot. Use any of the methods described above to capture the screen. This is how you can screenshot an entire website instead of only what's on your screen.

steps.title: Tap and hold the Scroll Capture icon.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Scroll Capture icon. The Scroll Capture icon looks like a chevron pattern (or an arrowhead pointing downwards.) It's on the menu that pops up at the bottom of the screen after you take a screenshot. Tapping the Scroll Capture icon once scrolls your screen down a page and includes that next page in your screenshot. This is good for screen capturing a social media feed or message thread.

steps.title: Hold the Scroll Capture icon until you've screenshotted everything.
steps.content: Hold the Scroll Capture icon until you've screenshotted everything. You can hold the Scroll Capture icon until your phone captures the entire webpage or until you've captured as much of the page as you want.

steps.title: Find your screenshot.
steps.content: Find your screenshot. A window will pop up at the bottom of the screen that you can tap to see your screen capture. You can also find your screenshots in the Gallery in the Screenshots album. You can also find editing tools in the menu at the bottom of the screen. You can use these tools to edit and mark up your screenshot.
